snippet.title: The Belle W. Baruch Foundation
snippet.description: * The Belle W. Baruch Foundation (clueweb12-1502wb-82-10940) http://www.hobcawbarony.org/History.HB.html The Belle W. Baruch FoundationHobcaw Barony A 17, 500 acre research reserve, Hobcaw Barony is one of the few undeveloped tracts on the Waccamaw Neck. The Native Americans called it "hobcaw," meaning between the waters. In 1718, the land became a colonial land grant, a barony. Sold and subdivided into plantations extending from... [cached version]

snippet.description: * The Belle W. Baruch Foundation (clueweb12-1502wb-90-06175) http://www.hobcawbarony.org/BWB.html ...a sailor, equestrian and pilot. She called Hobcaw Barony the "friendliest woods in the world," and always wanted to have a home here.
